metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29502 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
SchedMD Slurm 21.08.x through 20.11.x has Incorrect Access Control thatleads to Escalation of Privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 22.05.8-3
libpam-slurm-adopt - 22.05.8-3
libpmi0 - 22.05.8-3
libpmi2-0 - 22.05.8-3
libslurm-perl - 22.05.8-3
libslurm38 - 22.05.8-3
libslurmdb-perl - 22.05.8-3
slurm-client - 22.05.8-3
slurm-client-emulator - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-basic-plugins - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-elasticsearch-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-emulator - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-hdf5-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-influxdb-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-ipmi-plugins - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-jwt-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-mysql-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-plugins - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-rrd-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-rsmi-plugin - 22.05.8-3
slurm-wlm-torque - 22.05.8-3
slurmctld - 22.05.8-3
slurmd - 22.05.8-3
slurmdbd - 22.05.8-3
slurmrestd - 22.05.8-3
sview - 22.05.8-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-wlm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '22.05.8-3').
